alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 8:29PM CDT until April 02 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .The combination of rainfall from Friday and snow melt has caused moderate flooding along the Black River at Black River Falls, WI. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 49.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM CDT Saturday was 49.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 52.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 52.1 feet on 04/07/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 1230 PM CDT.
